attributes.status: Active'''Lady Forlorn''' is the Valyrian steel blade of House Corbray.<ref>"Valyrian Steel (Histories & Lore)"</ref>== In the books ==In the A Song of Ice and Fire
attributes.title: Lady Forlorn

sections.In the books:
In the [[A Song of Ice and Fire|''A Song of Ice and Fire'']] novels Lady Forlorn is currently in the possession of Ser Lyn Corbray, the eldest brother of Lord Lyonel Corbray, having inherited it for taking it in the [[Battle of the Trident]] after their father, then the Lord Corbray, had been wounded and uisng it to slay Prince [[Lewyn Martell]]. Lyonel still resents not having inherited the blade even though he inherited all family titles and lands.

Ser [[Gwayne Corbray]] of the [[Kingsguard]] bore Lady Forlorn during the [[Battle of Redgrass Field]] and fought [[Daemon Blackfyre]], who in turn bore [[Blackfyre]], with it.

The name "Lady Forlorn" is actually a legacy from the [[Andal invasion]] and predates the Valyrian steel blade. KingÂ Robar II RoyceÂ claimed the original Lady Forlorn after slayingÂ Qyle Corbray, King of theÂ Fingers. Robar wielded this Lady Forlorn during theÂ Battle of the Seven Stars, using it to killÂ Torgold TollettÂ and a decoy dressed as SerÂ [[Artys Arryn]]. The Corbrays claim that SerÂ Jaime CorbrayÂ slew Robar in the battle, allowing them to reclaim the original Lady Forlorn.
